trans-unit.source: Receives status information about a build from the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager"></xref> object.

A <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback> object can be passed to the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager> object through the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.PrecompileApplication%2A> method.

When an error is encountered during an application build, the error is passed as an argument to either the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback.ReportCompilerError%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback.ReportParseError%2A> method, depending on the type of error.
When you create a class that derives from the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback> class, you can implement these methods and retrieve the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback"></xref> class.
Returns a lifetime service object that can be used to control the lifetime policy for this instance.
Reports compilation errors and warnings that occur during an application build.
The error or warning encountered during compilation.
Reports parsing errors and warnings that occur during an application build.
The error or warning encountered during parsing.
Reports the progress of an application build.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the current status of the build.
